content: The "Integrated Water Resources Management Act of 2005" mandates the Army Corps of Engineers to provide technical services and assistance for water resource planning and management by State, tribal, interstate, and local governments. The Water Resources Development Act of 1974 is amended to include provisions for Federal-State cooperation in managing water resources, including technical assistance at Federal expense for managing water resources. The Water Resources Development Act of 1974 is amended to include provisions for Federal-State cooperation in managing water resources, including technical assistance at Federal expense. The Water Resources Development Act of 1974 is amended to include provisions for Federal-State cooperation in managing water resources, with $10,000,000 annually authorized for technical assistance, including cooperative agreements with nonprofit organizations and State agencies. The Secretary is required to provide a listing of proposed activities for funding based on performance criteria. SEC. 4. WATERSHED AND RIVER BASIN ASSESSMENTS amended to change non-Federal share of costs to 25 percent. Partnership agreements revised to reflect this change. SEC. 5. CREDIT FOR MATERIALS AND IN-KIND SERVICES. The Secretary of the Army can authorize a non-Federal entity to receive credit for providing materials and services for water resources projects. The credit cannot exceed the non-Federal share of project costs. The Secretary of the Army can authorize a non-Federal entity to receive credit for providing materials and services for water resources projects, as long as it does not exceed the non-Federal share of project costs and meets certain requirements set by the Secretary. Improving water management at Corps of Engineers reservoirs. The Secretary of the Army will implement measures to improve water management at Corps of Engineers reservoirs, including reallocation of storage, reviewing operational plans, enhancing data collection systems, and collaborating with State, tribal, and local governments. The Secretary of the Army will implement measures to improve water management at Corps of Engineers reservoirs, including reallocation of storage and sediment studies to enhance operational performance and reduce costs for water supply storage contracts. The Secretary of the Army will provide public access to water resources data held by the Corps of Engineers, including data from water projects and regulations. The program will utilize geographic information system technology and aim to involve State, tribal, and local governments. $5,000,000 per fiscal year is authorized for this initiative. SEC. 8. WRITTEN AGREEMENT FOR WATER RESOURCES PROJECTS. Section 221 of the Flood Control Act of 1970 is amended to include partnership agreements for water resources projects. Section 219 of the Water Resources Development Act of 1992 is amended to allow the non-Federal share to be provided in the form of materials and in-kind services deemed necessary for the project. Additionally, $40,000,000 is allocated for the project described in subsection (c)(18). SEC. 10. TEXAS ENVIRONMENTAL INFRASTRUCTURE PROGRAM. The Secretary of the Army will establish a program in Texas to provide environmental assistance to non-Federal interests. Assistance may include planning, design, and construction for water-related projects. Projects must be publicly owned to receive assistance. The Secretary will establish a program in Texas to provide environmental assistance to non-Federal interests for water-related projects that are publicly owned. Before providing assistance, a partnership agreement with a non-Federal interest must be entered into. The Federal share of project costs will be 75 percent, which can be in the form of grants or reimbursements. The non-Federal share may be provided in the form of materials and in-kind services, with credit given for design work completed by the non-Federal interest. The non-Federal interest must complete construction work before entering into a partnership agreement with the Secretary. They will receive credit for lands, easements, rights-of-way, and relocations provided towards project costs. The non-Federal share of operation and maintenance costs for projects will be 100 percent. This section does not affect the applicability of other Federal or State laws to the project. Authorization of Appropriations.--$40,000,000 is authorized to carry out this section.
